Tutorial

Michael Rustler

2019-03-13

Source: vignettes/tutorial.Rmd
tutorial.Rmd

Define config

config <- algoliar::create_config(app_id = "your_algolia_application_id",
                                  api_key = "your_algolia_api_key",
                                  index_name = "your_algolia_index_name",
                                  path_index_json = "path_to_your_index.json")

Get

algoliar::algolia_get(config)

Content

Content of “index.json” at Algolia as data.frame.

algoliar::algolia_content(config)

Prepare Batch

Preparing index.json so that it is accepted by Algolia for batch post (for details see: https://www.algolia.com/doc/api-reference/api-methods/add-objects/)

batch_json <- algoliar::prepare_batch_json(config)

Run Batch

For deleting/updating “index.json” at Algolia (for details see: https://www.algolia.com/doc/api-reference/api-methods/add-objects/)

algoliar::algolia_post_batch(config)

This function is useful if the “index.json” upload to Algolia should be automated (i.e. after creating a new hugo academic website)

Delete Index

For completly deleting an Algolia “index_name” run:

algoliar::algolia_delete_index(config)

This means that it needs to be created manually again from the Algolia dashboard, since a creation method is not implemented in the R Package
